asgn2RollingStock
Class FreightCar

Object
  asgn2RollingStock.RollingStock
      asgn2RollingStock.FreightCar

public class FreightCar
extends RollingStock

Freight cars are designed to handle a variety of goods. For the purposes of this assignment we assume there are three freight car types of interest, characterised by the kinds of goods they are designed to carry:

  • "G" - General goods
  • "R" - Refrigerated goods
  • "D" - Dangerous materials

Version:
1.0
Author:
INB370

Constructor Detail

FreightCar

public FreightCar(Integer grossWeight,
                  String goodsType)
           throws TrainException
Constructs a freight car object.

Parameters:
grossWeight - the freight car's gross weight (fully-laden), in tonnes
goodsType - the type of goods the car is designed to carry (either "G", "R" or "D")
Throws:
TrainException - if the gross weight is not positive or if the goods' type is invalid
Method Detail

goodsType

public String goodsType()
Returns the type of goods this carriage was designed to carry. (Simulates someone checking the label on the freight car to determine what's inside.)

Returns:
the goodsType (G", "R" or "D")

toString

public String toString()
Returns a human-readable description of the freight car. This has the form "Freight(x)" where x is a character ("G", "R" or "D") indicating the type of goods the car is designed to carry.

Specified by:
toString in class RollingStock
Returns:
a human-readable description of the freight car
